meanings.definition: To give a shout of encouragement or approval.
meanings.sent1: The crowd cheered loudly for the winning team.
meanings.sent2: The fans cheered when the singer took the stage.
meanings.sent3: The children cheered for their friend who won the race.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the crowd cheering filled the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The cheers of the audience echoed through the hall.

meanings.definition: To make happier or more cheerful.
meanings.sent1: The surprise party really cheered up my friend.
meanings.sent2: A walk in the park always cheers me up.
meanings.sent3: Watching a funny movie can really cheer you up.
meanings.sent4: The colorful flowers in the garden cheered her spirits.
meanings.sent5: The kind words from a friend can cheer you up instantly.

meanings.definition: To applaud or shout in support.
meanings.sent1: The audience cheered for the talented performer.
meanings.sent2: The crowd cheered as the team scored a goal.
meanings.sent3: The students cheered for their classmate during the presentation.
meanings.sent4: The fans cheered on their favorite team until the end.
meanings.sent5: The supporters cheered loudly at the rally.
